HL7 Standard.summary: This FHIR Implementation Guide (IG) focuses on enabling electronic submission of Healthcare Associated Infection (HAI) data from Long Term Care Facilities (LTCFs) to the National Healthcare Safety Network (NHSN) using FHIR resources, specifically Questionnaire and QuestionnaireResponse. It leverages US Core profiles and VSAC-defined value sets. While it mentions a parallel CDA IG, the focus of this IG is purely on FHIR. It does not utilize HL7 v2 or v3.

Geographic Scope.summary: This Implementation Guide is specifically designed for reporting Healthcare Associated Infections (HAIs) from Long Term Care Facilities (LTCFs) to the National Healthcare Safety Network (NHSN) in the United States. It leverages US Core profiles and is developed in parallel with an HL7 CDA IG. The mention of the CDC and NHSN, along with the use of US Core, clearly indicates a national scope within the United States.

Domain Focus.summary: This FHIR Implementation Guide focuses on facilitating the electronic submission of Healthcare Associated Infection (HAI) data, specifically for Multidrug-Resistant Organism (MDRO) and *C. difficile* Infection (CDI) events, from Long Term Care Facilities (LTCFs) to the National Healthcare Safety Network (NHSN). It leverages FHIR Questionnaires and QuestionnaireResponses to structure and transmit this data, aiming to improve data quality, timeliness, and efficiency compared to manual reporting. While it touches upon administrative aspects like patient demographics and care location, its core purpose revolves around public health surveillance and quality reporting related to HAIs in the LTCF setting.

Implementers.summary: This IG focuses on enabling Long-Term Care Facilities (LTCFs) to electronically submit Healthcare Associated Infection (HAI) data to the National Healthcare Safety Network (NHSN). Therefore, EHR systems within LTCFs and the Public Health Systems that receive this data (NHSN) are the primary implementers. Other systems play a less significant role.

Users & Stakeholders.summary: This FHIR Implementation Guide (IG) primarily focuses on streamlining the electronic submission of Healthcare Associated Infection (HAI) data from Long Term Care Facilities (LTCFs) to the National Healthcare Safety Network (NHSN). The design is driven by the needs of Public Health Agencies (specifically the CDC's NHSN) to collect standardized, high-quality data for surveillance and quality improvement. Clinical Care Teams within LTCFs, particularly infection preventionists, are key users responsible for data entry and submission. Government Agencies have a significant role in setting the reporting requirements and overseeing the program. While other groups like Healthcare Administrators and Research Organizations may benefit from the data, their influence on the IG's design is less direct.
